title: Stale harness processes not cleaned up between runs
description: When running make run-dumb multiple times, old Java/Python processes from previous runs can linger and hold ports. Saw old puppeteer processes from days ago still running, and the overlay port auto-incremented to 17889 because 17888 was still bound by a previous run. The harness should either kill previous instances on startup or detect stale processes. The port auto-increment is a good fallback but makes it harder to find the right URL.
